bill_title: to allow certain persons with special expertise to instruct in public schools.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow certain persons with special expertise to instruct in public schools. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, any person with special expertise in an area that may be taught in a course of instruction in South Dakota's public schools is deemed qualified to instruct in the person's area of expertise. A course of instruction in which a person with special expertise instructs as allowed by this Act shall be for full credit for students in the course, as though the person with special expertise were certified to teach in accordance with chapter 13-42. Section 2. For the purposes of this Act, areas of special expertise include, but are not limited to, business, science, mathematics, social sciences, government, history, foreign languages, agriculture, building trades, carpentry, construction, or music. Section 3. The Department of Education and Cultural Affairs may promulgate rules in accordance with chapter 1-26 to implement the provisions of this Act. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
